t: Jeremiah 30
Restoration from Captivity
This*p is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord.*s
“This is what the Lord,*s the God of Israel, says: Write on a scroll all the words that I have spoken to you,

for look, the days are coming” — this is the Lord’s*s declaration — “when I will restore the fortunes of my people Israel and Judah,” says the Lord.*s “I will restore them to the land I gave to their ancestors and they will possess it.”
These*p are the words the Lord*s spoke to Israel and Judah.
This is what the Lord*s says: We*pn have heard a cry of terror, of*ln dread — there is no peace.
Ask*ln and see whether*ln a male can give birth. Why*ln then do I see every man with*ln his hands on his stomach like a woman in labor and*ln every face turned pale?
How*ln awful that day will be! There*ln will be no other like it! It*ln will be a time of trouble for Jacob, but*ln he will be saved out of it.
On*ln that day — this*lg is the declaration of the Lord*s of Armies — I*pn will break his yoke from your neck and*ln tear off your chains, and*ln strangers will never again enslave him.
They*ln will serve the Lord*s their God and*ln David their king, whom*ln I will raise up for them.

As*ln for you, my servant Jacob, do*ln not be afraid — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — and*pn do not be discouraged, Israel, for*ln without fail I will save you out of a distant place, your*ln descendants, from the land of their captivity! Jacob*ln will return and have calm and quiet with*ln no one to frighten him.

For*ln I will be with you — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — to*pn save you! I*ln will bring destruction on all the nations where*ln I have scattered you; however,*ln I will not bring destruction on you. I*ln will discipline you justly, and*ln I will by no means leave you unpunished.
Healing Zion’s Wounds
For*p this is what the Lord*s says: Your*pn injury is incurable; your*ln wound most severe.
You*ln have no defender for your case. There*ln is no remedy for your sores, and*ln no healing for you.

All*ln your lovers have forgotten you; they*ln no longer look for you, for*ln I have struck you as an enemy would, with*ln the discipline of someone cruel, because*ln of your enormous guilt and*ln your innumerable sins.
Why*ln do you cry out about your injury? Your*ln pain has no cure! I*ln have done these things to you because*ln of your enormous guilt and*ln your innumerable sins.

Nevertheless,*ln all who devoured you will be devoured, and*ln all your adversaries — all of them — will*ln go off into exile. Those*ln who plunder you will be plundered, and*ln all who raid you will be raided.
But*ln I will bring you health and*ln will heal you of your wounds — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — for*pn they call you Outcast, Zion*ln whom no one cares about.
Restoration of the Land

This*p is what the Lord*s says: I*pn will certainly restore the fortunes of Jacob’s tents and*ln show compassion on his dwellings. Every*ln city will be rebuilt on its mound; every*ln citadel will stand on its proper site.
Thanksgiving*ln will come out of them, a*ln sound of rejoicing. I*ln will multiply them, and they will not decrease; I*ln will honor them, and they will not be insignificant.
His*ln children will be as in past days; his*ln congregation will be established in my presence. I*ln will punish all his oppressors.

Jacob’s*ln leader will be one of them; his*ln ruler will issue from him. I*ln will invite him to me, and he will approach me, for*ln who would otherwise risk his life to approach me? This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
You*pn will be my people, and*ln I will be your God.
The Wrath of God
Look,*pn a storm from the Lord!*s Wrath*ln has gone out, a*ln churning storm. It*ln will whirl about the heads of the wicked.
The*ln Lord’s*s burning anger will not turn back until*ln he has completely fulfilled the purposes of his heart. In*ln time to come you will understand it.
